title: Document Frontend React Components and Hooks
description: Add comprehensive JSDoc documentation to all React components and custom hooks in the frontend, including prop types, usage examples, component purposes, state management, and side effects.

phases.name: UI Primitive Components Documentation
phases.description: Document foundational UI components used throughout the application

subtasks.title: Document Button component
subtasks.description: Add JSDoc documentation to Button.tsx including prop types (variant, size), usage examples, and styling behavior
subtasks.notes:
Added comprehensive JSDoc documentation to Button.tsx including:
- Component description with features and styling behavior
- Props interface documentation with detailed descriptions
- Multiple usage examples demonstrating all variants and sizes
- Default value documentation
- Display name for better debugging experience

Documentation covers all three variants (primary, secondary, destructive) and all three sizes (sm, md, lg), with examples showing disabled state, custom className usage, and accessibility features.

subtasks.title: Document Input component
subtasks.description: Add JSDoc documentation to Input.tsx including prop inheritance from HTML input, styling, and common usage patterns
subtasks.notes:
Added comprehensive JSDoc documentation to Input.tsx including:
- Component description with features and styling behavior
- InputProps interface documentation extending React.InputHTMLAttributes
- Detailed explanation of styling with Tailwind CSS classes
- Multiple usage examples demonstrating common input types (text, email, password, number, file)
- Examples showing controlled and uncontrolled patterns
- Documentation of disabled state, validation, and custom className usage
- Display name for better debugging experience

Documentation covers all standard HTML input types with examples showing:
- Controlled state management with value and onChange
- Uncontrolled inputs with ref
- HTML5 validation attributes (required, pattern, min, max, minLength, maxLength)
- File upload inputs with accept attribute
- Custom styling via className prop
- Accessibility features including focus-visible ring and disabled cursor

subtasks.title: Document Select component
subtasks.description: Add JSDoc documentation to Select.tsx including prop types and usage with options
subtasks.notes:
Added comprehensive JSDoc documentation to Select.tsx including:
- Component description with features and styling behavior
- Props interface documentation with detailed descriptions
- Multiple usage examples demonstrating:
  * Basic controlled select with options
  * Required validation
  * Option groups using <optgroup>
  * Multi-select mode with array state management
  * Disabled state
  * Custom className usage
  * Uncontrolled usage with ref
  * Dynamic options from data arrays
- Display name for better debugging experience

Documentation covers all standard HTML select attributes including value, onChange, multiple, size, disabled, required, and children prop for option/optgroup elements. Examples show both controlled and uncontrolled patterns, validation, and common real-world usage scenarios.

subtasks.title: Document Textarea component
subtasks.description: Add JSDoc documentation to Textarea.tsx including prop types and styling behavior
subtasks.notes:
Added comprehensive JSDoc documentation to Textarea.tsx including:
- Component description with features and styling behavior
- Props interface documentation with detailed descriptions
- Multiple usage examples demonstrating:
  * Basic controlled textarea with state management
  * Character limit with counter display
  * Validation (required, minLength, maxLength)
  * Custom height with rows attribute
  * Disabled state
  * Custom styling (resize-none, font-mono)
  * Uncontrolled usage with ref
  * Code input with monospace font and spellCheck disabled
  * Form integration with label and error message
- Display name for better debugging experience

Documentation covers all standard HTML textarea attributes including value, onChange, placeholder, rows, cols, disabled, readOnly, required, minLength, maxLength, wrap, autoComplete, autoFocus, spellCheck, and event handlers. Examples show both controlled and uncontrolled patterns, validation, and common real-world usage scenarios for multi-line text input.

subtasks.title: Document Switch component
subtasks.description: Add JSDoc documentation to Switch.tsx including toggle behavior, checked state, and accessibility
subtasks.notes:
Added comprehensive JSDoc documentation to Switch.tsx including:
- Component description with features and toggle behavior
- Detailed explanation of toggle behavior (click, keyboard, programmatic control)
- Checked state section describing visual changes (background color, slider position)
- Comprehensive accessibility section covering screen reader support, keyboard navigation, focus management, and ARIA attributes
- Styling behavior section explaining Tailwind CSS implementation with peer modifier pattern
- Props interface documentation with detailed descriptions of common props
- 8 usage examples demonstrating:
  * Basic controlled switch with state management
  * Uncontrolled switch with defaultChecked
  * Switch with label wrapper
  * Disabled state
  * Change handler with callbacks
  * Form integration with name attributes
  * Custom className for additional styling
  * Using ref for programmatic control
- Display name for better debugging experience

Documentation covers all aspects of the toggle switch including controlled/uncontrolled patterns, checked/unchecked states, keyboard accessibility (Space/Enter), screen reader compatibility, focus rings, dark mode support, and smooth transition animations.

subtasks.title: Document Card component
subtasks.description: Add JSDoc documentation to Card.tsx including CardHeader, CardTitle, CardDescription, CardContent, CardFooter sub-components
subtasks.notes:
Added comprehensive JSDoc documentation to Card.tsx including:
- Card component system overview with features and modular component structure
- Individual documentation for all 6 components (Card, CardHeader, CardTitle, CardDescription, CardContent, CardFooter)
- Detailed props documentation extending HTML attributes
- Styling behavior sections explaining Tailwind CSS classes and layout patterns
- Multiple usage examples for each component demonstrating:
  * Basic card with all sections (header, content, footer)
  * Simple cards with minimal structure
  * Cards with footer action buttons
  * Custom styling patterns with className
  * Content-only cards without headers
  * Common layout patterns (right-aligned footers, space-between layouts, centered content)
- Display names for all components for better debugging
- Usage notes for proper spacing when components are used independently (e.g., CardContent without CardHeader)

Documentation covers:
- Component hierarchy and typical structure
- Flexbox layouts for CardHeader (column) and CardFooter (row)
- Theme-aware colors (bg-card, text-card-foreground, text-muted-foreground)
- Padding patterns (p-6 for sections, pt-0 for content/footer assuming headers above)
- Typography styles (text-2xl semibold for titles, text-sm muted for descriptions)
- Ref forwarding support for all components
- Extension of standard HTML attributes for full flexibility

subtasks.title: Document Dialog component
subtasks.description: Add JSDoc documentation to Dialog.tsx including DialogHeader, DialogTitle, DialogContent, DialogFooter, DialogClose sub-components
subtasks.notes:
Added comprehensive JSDoc documentation to Dialog.tsx including:
- Dialog component system overview with features and modal behavior
- Individual documentation for all 6 components (Dialog, DialogContent, DialogHeader, DialogTitle, DialogDescription, DialogFooter)
- Detailed props documentation extending HTML attributes
- Styling behavior sections explaining Tailwind CSS classes and responsive layouts
- Multiple usage examples for each component demonstrating:
  * Basic dialog with all sections (header, content, footer)
  * Simple dialogs with minimal structure
  * Form dialogs with input fields
  * Custom dialog sizing and styling
  * Responsive behavior (mobile vs desktop)
- Display names for all components for better debugging
- DialogProps interface with property documentation

Documentation covers:
- Component hierarchy and typical structure
- Modal overlay with semi-transparent backdrop (bg-black/80)
- Click-outside-to-close functionality
- Event propagation control (stopPropagation on content)
- Animations (fade-in-fast for backdrop, scale-in for content)
- Z-index layering (z-50)
- Responsive layouts:
  * DialogHeader: center-aligned on mobile, left-aligned on desktop
  * DialogFooter: column-reverse on mobile, row with right-align on desktop
- Grid layout for DialogContent with gap-4 spacing
- Theme-aware colors (bg-background, text-muted-foreground)
- Typography styles (text-lg semibold for titles, text-sm muted for descriptions)
- Ref forwarding support for DialogContent, DialogTitle, and DialogDescription

Note: The subtask description mentioned "DialogClose" but this component does not exist in the file. All actual components in the file have been documented: Dialog, DialogContent, DialogHeader, DialogTitle, DialogDescription, and DialogFooter.

subtasks.title: Document ProgressBar component
subtasks.description: Add JSDoc documentation to ProgressBar.tsx including value prop, animation behavior, and styling options
subtasks.notes: Added comprehensive JSDoc documentation to ProgressBar.tsx including component overview, features list, color-coding behavior, animation behavior (transition-all duration-300 ease-in-out), styling options (Tailwind classes and size variants), multiple usage examples, and detailed prop documentation for value, className, showLabel, and size props. Documentation follows the established pattern from Button.tsx.

subtasks.title: Document ArrayEditor component
subtasks.description: Add JSDoc documentation to ArrayEditor.tsx including value handling, add/remove item functionality, and callbacks
subtasks.notes:
Added comprehensive JSDoc documentation to ArrayEditor.tsx including:
- Component description with features and controlled component pattern
- Detailed value handling section explaining immutability and state management
- Add/remove item functionality section with user interaction details
- Callbacks section documenting onChange with all three invocation scenarios
- Styling behavior section explaining Tailwind CSS classes and layout patterns
- Props interface documentation with detailed descriptions for value, onChange, placeholder, disabled, and label
- 7 usage examples demonstrating:
  * Basic usage with controlled state
  * Label and custom placeholder
  * Initial values
  * Disabled state (read-only view)
  * Empty state
  * Form integration with validation
  * Callback with side effects
- Display name for better debugging experience

Documentation covers:
- Controlled component pattern with onChange callbacks
- Array immutability (creates new arrays, never mutates)
- Three modification types: add (append empty string), remove (filter by index), edit (replace at index)
- Empty state display when no items exist
- Disabled state behavior (hides controls, disables inputs)
- Full keyboard accessibility
- Smooth transitions on remove button hover
- Icon usage (PlusIcon, TrashIcon)

subtasks.title: Document KeyValueEditor component
subtasks.description: Add JSDoc documentation to KeyValueEditor.tsx including key-value pair management and change callbacks
subtasks.notes:
Added comprehensive JSDoc documentation to KeyValueEditor.tsx including:

- Detailed props documentation for all 6 props (value, onChange, disabled, label, keyPlaceholder, valuePlaceholder)

subtasks.title: Document Icons component

Documentation follows established pattern from Button.tsx and other UI components, providing developers with a complete reference for all available icons and their recommended use cases throughout the application.

subtasks.title: Document Layout component

subtasks.notes:
Added comprehensive JSDoc documentation to Layout.tsx including:

subtasks.title: Document Sidebar component
subtasks.description: Add JSDoc documentation to Sidebar.tsx including navigation items, active state, and collapse behavior
subtasks.notes:
Added comprehensive JSDoc documentation to Sidebar.tsx including:
- Component description with features and navigation functionality
- Detailed Navigation Items section listing all 8 menu items with icons and their purposes
- Active State section explaining visual highlighting (bg-primary/10 for active, text-muted-foreground for inactive)
- Directory Selector (Optional) section documenting bottom sticky footer with directory path display
- Layout Structure diagram showing flex column organization with header, nav (flex-1), and optional directory selector
- Styling Behavior section explaining Tailwind CSS classes and theme colors
- Props interface documentation with detailed descriptions for activeView, onNavigate, directoryName, and onChangeDirectory
- Four usage examples demonstrating:
  * Basic sidebar with active view highlighting
  * Sidebar with directory selector
  * Sidebar integrated in Layout component
  * Sidebar with directory tracking and navigation
- Display name for better debugging experience

Documentation covers:
- 8 navigation items: Dashboard, Chat, Agents, Commands, Skills, MCP Servers, Tasks, Settings
- Active/inactive state styling with hover transitions (bg-secondary on hover)
- Optional directory selector with truncation, title tooltip, and "Change Directory" button
- Flex layout with nav taking flex-1 and directory selector at mt-auto (sticky bottom)
- Theme-aware colors for active (bg-primary/10, text-primary), inactive (text-muted-foreground), and hover (bg-secondary, text-foreground) states
- Full keyboard navigation support
- Icon integration from Icons.tsx (5x5 size icons)
- Fixed width sidebar (w-64 = 256px) with padding p-4

Note: The subtask mentioned "collapse behavior" but the actual implementation does not include collapse/expand functionality. Documented the component as implemented with fixed-width sidebar that remains visible at all times.

subtasks.title: Document ChatDisplayContext
subtasks.description: Add JSDoc documentation to ChatDisplayContext.tsx including context values, provider usage, and consumer patterns
subtasks.notes:
Added comprehensive JSDoc documentation to ChatDisplayContext.tsx including:

- Provider usage section with code examples

- useChatDisplay hook documentation with error handling and return value details
- Five comprehensive usage examples at module level demonstrating:

  * Accessing tool uses for messages in message display
  * Clearing event data when switching sessions
  * Adding tool use data from SDK events
- Four additional examples in useChatDisplay hook for:
  * Basic view mode access in header
  * Message bubble with tool use display
  * Debug panel accessing multiple context values
  * Session switcher clearing events on change

Documentation follows established pattern from Button.tsx and Layout.tsx, providing developers with a complete reference for:
- Context architecture and state management
- Provider setup at app or page level
- Hook usage patterns for accessing context
- Helper function usage for querying message-related events
- Session management and event data lifecycle
- Type-safe API with comprehensive TypeScript documentation

Committed with message: auto-claude: 2.3 - Add JSDoc documentation to ChatDisplayContext.tsx

phases.name: Custom Hooks Documentation
phases.description: Document all custom hooks with state management, side effects, and usage patterns

subtasks.title: Document useAgentCreator hook
subtasks.description: Add comprehensive JSDoc documentation including options interface, return values, state management, SSE streaming handling, and lifecycle
subtasks.notes:
Added comprehensive JSDoc documentation to useAgentCreator.ts including:
- Module-level documentation with features, state management, SSE streaming handling, and lifecycle sections
- Detailed documentation for all interfaces (Message, UseAgentCreatorOptions, UseAgentCreatorReturn)
- Options interface documentation with detailed property descriptions for directory, onAgentCreated, and onError
- Return values interface documentation covering messages, isProcessing, isCreating, createdAgentName, error, startConversation, sendMessage, and reset
- State management section explaining all five state categories (Message, Processing, Creation, Result, Error)
- SSE streaming handling section with stream lifecycle, event types, tool use detection, and stream cancellation details
- Lifecycle section outlining the typical usage flow from initialization to reset
- Authentication section documenting automatic token-based auth with cookie management
- Four comprehensive usage examples demonstrating:
  * Basic usage with agent creation detection
  * Custom directory and callbacks
  * Handling user input and sending messages
  * Reset conversation after agent creation
- Internal function documentation for getAuthToken, createFetchOptions, sendMessageInternal, startConversation, sendMessage, handleStreamEvent, and reset
- @internal tags for helper and internal functions
- @param and @returns tags for all functions
- Detailed inline examples in interface property documentation

Documentation follows established pattern from Button.tsx and ChatDisplayContext.tsx, providing developers with complete reference for:
- Hook initialization with options
- State management across conversation lifecycle
- SSE streaming internals and event processing
- Tool use detection for agent file creation
- Error handling and callbacks
- Session management and cleanup
- Type-safe API with comprehensive TypeScript documentation

subtasks.title: Document useAssistantRuntime hook
subtasks.description: Add comprehensive JSDoc documentation including runtime state, message handling, and integration with assistant UI
subtasks.notes:
Added comprehensive JSDoc documentation to useAssistantRuntime.ts including:
- Module-level documentation with features, runtime state, message handling, and integration with assistant UI
- Detailed documentation of all sections:
  * Runtime State: message state, running state, SDK event state, stream control state
  * Message Handling: message flow (10 steps), format conversion, optimistic updates, throttled updates
  * Integration with Assistant UI: adapter interface, compatible components, event propagation
  * SSE Event Handling: event types, SDK message processing, stream cancellation
  * Directory Integration: cookie-based directory selection
  * Permission Modes: default, bypass, auto, plan
  * Lifecycle: 12-step usage flow from initialization to unmount
- Props interface documentation with detailed property descriptions for all 8 props
- Four comprehensive usage examples demonstrating:
  * Basic usage with chat session
  * Agent and skill binding
  * SDK event tracking for tool use display
  * Permission mode switching
- Internal function documentation for:
  * convertToThreadMessage - ChatMessage to ThreadMessage conversion
  * getDirectory - Cookie-based directory retrieval
  * throttledUpdate - Performance optimization for rapid deltas
  * handleNewMessage - User message submission workflow
  * handleCancel - Stream cancellation handling
  * handleSetMessages - ExternalStoreAdapter wrapper
- All internal functions marked with @internal tags
- @param and @returns tags for all functions
- Detailed inline examples in property documentation

Documentation follows established pattern from useAgentCreator.ts, providing developers with complete reference for:
- Hook initialization with runtime props
- Runtime state management across conversation lifecycle
- Message format conversion between backend and UI
- SSE streaming internals and event processing
- SDK event tracking (tool uses, tool results, system messages)
- Performance optimization via throttling
- Stream cancellation and error handling
- Integration with assistant-ui components
- Type-safe API with comprehensive TypeScript documentation

Committed changes with git.

subtasks.title: Document ComposerArea component

subtasks.notes:
Added comprehensive JSDoc documentation to ComposerArea.tsx including:
- Component description with features and integration with assistant-ui primitives
- Detailed sections on:
  * Message Composition - ComposerPrimitive integration with assistant-ui runtime
  * Attachments - Upload workflow, supported file types, preview display, removal

- Directory Management section covering selection flow, localStorage persistence, directory usage, and change directory workflow
- State Management section explaining all state categories (view navigation, directory, validation, resource discovery, modal)
- Theme Handling section documenting setup/dashboard phase styling and color scheme
- Error Handling section covering validation errors, resource reload errors, and API error handling
- Four comprehensive usage examples demonstrating basic usage, setup flow, dashboard navigation, and directory change flow
- Internal function documentation for all handlers (useEffect, handleGetStarted, handleDirectoryChange, startValidation, handleChangeDirectory, handleNextFromLanding, handleBackToHome, handleAgentCreated, handleSkillCreated, renderSetupContent, renderDashboardContent)
- All internal functions marked with @internal tags
- SetupStep type documentation
- Display name for better debugging experience

Documentation covers two-phase workflow (setup vs dashboard), multi-step setup with validation, client-side routing with 8 dashboard views, persistent directory selection via localStorage, resource discovery and state management, and error handling with retry capability.

Committed changes with git.

Documentation covers:
- Hero section with gradient text effect (gray-200 to gray-500, bg-clip-text technique)
- Responsive typography (4xl mobile, 5xl tablet, 6xl desktop)

- Three-column feature grid (1 col mobile, 3 cols md+ at 768px breakpoint)

- Hover effects on cards (border-primary/50 transition-colors)
- Animation (animate-fade-in class on mount)
- Complete navigation flow integration with ManagerApp setup workflow
- Layout structure with 4 distinct sections (spacing: mt-4, mt-10, mt-20, mt-8)
- Card styling (bg-secondary/50, border-secondary, hover:border-primary/50)
